intro: Gonospermum canariense subsp. elegans, commonly known as the Canary Island velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid and saline conditions of its native habitat. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
